intro: Cleomella hillmanii var. goodrichii, commonly known as the Goodrich's cleomella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Cleomaceae family, which includes various species of flowering plants often found in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, featuring slender stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in its dry habitat. This variety is notable for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and its adaptation to harsh environmental conditions.
